Now therefore arise,<WH6965> go out,<WH3318> and speak<WH1696> to comfort<WH3820> your servants;<WH5650> for I swear<WH7650> by Yahweh,<WH3068> if you don't<WH3318> go out, not a man<WH3885> will stay<WH3885> with you this night.<WH3915> That would be worse<WH7489> to you than all the evil<WH7451> that has happened<WH935> to you from your youth until now.<WH5271>"

Then the king<WH4428> arose,<WH6965> and sat<WH3427> in the gate.<WH8179> They told<WH5046> to all the people,<WH5971> saying,<WH559> "Behold,<WH4428> the king is sitting<WH3427> in the gate.<WH8179>" All the people<WH5971> came<WH935> before<WH6440> the king.<WH4428> Now Israel<WH3478> had fled<WH5127> every man<WH376> to his tent.<WH168>

All the people<WH5971> were at strife<WH1777> throughout all the tribes<WH7626> of Israel,<WH3478> saying,<WH559> "The king<WH4428> delivered<WH5337> us out of the hand<WH3709> of our enemies,<WH341> and he saved<WH4422> us out of the hand<WH3709> of the Philistines;<WH6430> and now he has fled<WH1272> out of the land<WH776> from Absalom.<WH53>
Absalom,<WH53> whom we anointed<WH4886> over us,<WH4191> is dead in battle.<WH4421> Now therefore why don't<WH2790> you speak a word of bringing<WH7725> the king<WH4428> back?<WH7725>"

King<WH4428> David<WH1732> sent<WH7971> to Zadok<WH6659> and to Abiathar<WH54> the priests,<WH3548> saying,<WH559> "Speak<WH1696> to the elders<WH2205> of Judah,<WH3063> saying,<WH559> <WH314> 'Why are you the last to bring<WH7725> the king<WH4428> back<WH7725> to his house?<WH1004> Since the speech<WH1697> of all Israel<WH3478> has come<WH935> to the king,<WH4428> to return him to his house.<WH1004>
You are my brothers,<WH251> you are my bone<WH6106> and my flesh.<WH1320> Why then are you the last<WH314> to bring back<WH7725> the king?<WH4428>'

Say<WH559> to Amasa,<WH6021> <WH6106> 'Aren't you my bone and my flesh?<WH1320> God<WH430> do<WH6213> so to me,<WH3254> and more also,<WH8269> if you aren't captain of the army<WH6635> before<WH6440> me continually<WH3117> in the room<WH8478> of Joab.<WH3097>'"

He bowed<WH5186> the heart<WH3824> of all the men<WH376> of Judah,<WH3063> even as one<WH259> man;<WH376> so that they sent<WH7971> to the king,<WH4428> saying,<WH7725> "Return, you and all your servants.<WH5650>"

So the king<WH4428> returned,<WH7725> and came<WH935> to the Jordan.<WH3383> Judah<WH3063> came<WH935> to Gilgal,<WH1537> to go<WH3212> to meet<WH7125> the king,<WH4428> to bring<WH5674> the king<WH4428> over<WH5674> the Jordan.<WH3383>

Shimei<WH8096> the son<WH1121> of Gera,<WH1617> the Benjamite,<WH1145> who was of Bahurim,<WH980> hurried<WH4116> and came down<WH3381> with the men<WH376> of Judah<WH3063> to meet<WH7125> king<WH4428> David.<WH1732>

He said<WH559> to the king,<WH4428> "Don't<WH113> let my lord impute<WH2803> iniquity<WH5771> to me,<WH2142> nor remember that which your servant<WH5650> did perversely<WH5753> the day<WH3117> that my lord<WH113> the king<WH4428> went out<WH3318> of Jerusalem,<WH3389> that the king<WH4428> should take<WH7760> it to his heart.<WH3820>

For your servant<WH5650> knows<WH3045> that I have sinned.<WH2398> Therefore,<WH935> behold, I have come this day<WH3117> the first<WH7223> of all the house<WH1004> of Joseph<WH3130> to go down<WH3381> to meet<WH7125> my lord<WH113> the king.<WH4428>"
But Abishai<WH52> the son<WH1121> of Zeruiah<WH6870> answered,<WH6030> "Shall Shimei<WH8096> not be put to death<WH4191> for this,<WH7043> because he cursed Yahweh<WH3068>'s anointed?<WH4899>"

Mephibosheth<WH4648> the son<WH1121> of Saul<WH7586> came down<WH3381> to meet<WH7125> the king;<WH4428> and he had neither<WH3808> groomed<WH6213> his feet,<WH7272> nor trimmed<WH6213> his beard,<WH8222> nor washed<WH3526> his clothes,<WH899> from the day<WH3117> the king<WH4428> departed<WH3212> until the day<WH3117> he came<WH935> home in peace.<WH7965>

He answered,<WH559> "My lord,<WH113> O king,<WH4428> my servant<WH5650> deceived<WH7411> me.<WH5650> For your servant said,<WH559> I will saddle<WH2280> me a donkey,<WH2543> that I may ride<WH7392> thereon,<WH3212> and go with the king;<WH4428> because your servant<WH5650> is lame.<WH6455>

He has slandered<WH7270> your servant<WH5650> to my lord<WH113> the king;<WH4428> but my lord<WH113> the king<WH4428> is as an angel<WH4397> of God.<WH430> Do<WH6213> therefore what is good<WH2896> in your eyes.<WH5869>

For all my father<WH1>'s house<WH1004> were but<WH3808> dead<WH4194> men<WH582> before my lord<WH113> the king;<WH4428> yet you set<WH7896> your servant<WH5650> among those who ate<WH398> at your own table.<WH7979> What right<WH6666> therefore have<WH3426> I yet that I should cry<WH2199> any more to the king?<WH4428>"
The king<WH4428> said<WH559> to him,<WH1696> "Why do you speak any more of your matters?<WH1697> I say,<WH559> you and Ziba<WH6717> divide<WH2505> the land.<WH7704>"

Mephibosheth<WH4648> said<WH559> to the king,<WH4428> "Yes,<WH3947> let him take all,<WH310> because <WH834> my lord<WH113> the king<WH4428> has come<WH935> in peace<WH7965> to his own house.<WH1004>"
Barzillai<WH1271> the Gileadite<WH1569> came down<WH3381> from Rogelim;<WH7274> and he went over<WH5674> the Jordan<WH3383> with the king,<WH4428> to conduct<WH7971> him over the Jordan.<WH3383>

Now Barzillai<WH1271> was a very<WH3966> aged<WH2204> man,<WH8084> even eighty years<WH8141> old:<WH1121> and he had provided the king<WH4428> with sustenance<WH3557> while he lay<WH7871> at Mahanaim;<WH4266> for he was a very<WH3966> great<WH1419> man.<WH376>
The king<WH4428> said<WH559> to Barzillai,<WH1271> "Come over<WH5674> with me,<WH3557> and I will sustain you with me in Jerusalem.<WH3389>"
Barzillai<WH1271> said<WH559> to the king,<WH4428> "How many<WH3117> are the days of the years of my life,<WH8141> that I should go up<WH5927> with the king<WH4428> to Jerusalem?<WH3389>

I am this day<WH3117> eighty<WH8084> years<WH8141> old.<WH1121> Can I discern<WH3045> between good<WH2896> and bad?<WH7451> Can your servant<WH5650> taste<WH2938> what<WH834> I eat<WH398> or what<WH834> I drink?<WH8354> Can I hear<WH8085> any more the voice<WH6963> of singing men<WH7891> and singing women?<WH7891> Why then should your servant<WH5650> be yet a burden<WH4853> to my lord<WH113> the king?<WH4428>

Please let your servant<WH5650> turn back again,<WH7725> that I may die<WH4191> in my own city,<WH5892> by the grave<WH6913> of my father<WH1> and my mother.<WH517> But behold,<WH5650> your servant Chimham;<WH3643> let him go over<WH5674> with my lord<WH113> the king;<WH4428> and do<WH6213> to him what shall seem good to you.<WH2896>"

So the king<WH4428> went over<WH5674> to Gilgal,<WH1537> and Chimham<WH3643> went over<WH5674> with him.<WH5971> All the people of Judah<WH3063> brought<WH5674> the king<WH4428> over,<WH2677> and also half the people<WH5971> of Israel.<WH3478>

All the men<WH376> of Judah<WH3063> answered<WH6030> the men<WH376> of Israel,<WH3478> "Because the king<WH4428> is a close relative<WH7138> to us.<WH2734> Why then are you angry about this matter?<WH1697> Have we eaten<WH398> at all<WH398> at the king<WH4428>'s cost?<WH5375> Or has he given us any gift?<WH5379>"

The men<WH376> of Israel<WH3478> answered<WH6030> the men<WH376> of Judah,<WH3063> and said,<WH6030> "We have ten<WH6235> parts<WH3027> in the king,<WH4428> and we<WH589> have also more claim to David<WH1732> than you.<WH7043> Why then did you despise us,<WH1697> that our advice should not be first<WH7223> had in bringing back<WH7725> our king?<WH4428>" The words<WH1697> of the men<WH376> of Judah<WH3063> were fiercer<WH7185> than the words<WH1697> of the men<WH376> of Israel.<WH3478>
